record.title: PUBLIC SAFETY EMPLOYER-EMPLOYEE COOPERATION ACT OF 2007
record.narrative:
PUBLIC SAFETY EMPLOYER-EMPLOYEE COOPERATION ACT OF 2007 -- (Senate - May 13, 2008)

[Page: S4072]

speaking.paragraph: Is the Chair going to report the bill now?

record.chair: Under the previous order, the motion to proceed is agreed to. The clerk will report.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 980) to provide collective bargaining rights for public safety officers employed by States or their political subdivisions.
AMENDMENT NO. 4751<center>(Purpose: In the nature of a substitute)</center>

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, on behalf of Senator Kennedy and Senator Gregg, I send a substitute to the desk.

record.chair: The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
The Senator from Nevada [Mr. Reid], for Mr. Gregg, for himself, and Mr. Kennedy, proposes an amendment numbered 4751.
record.narrative: (The amendment is printed in today's Record under "Text of Amendments.")
